stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the cowboy world (Course 12) – specifically the saloon interior and its secret cave.  He imports geometry, fixes shading, experiments with textures and begins designing a mine-cart chase set-piece (three Shy Guys flee after being caught drinking illegal chocolate milk).

development_findings.summary: Most of the saloon’s geometry is now imported; only the sky-box/background and some props (milk bottles, cactus) are missing.
Shading problem on Shy Guy models solved by editing combiners to remove unwanted environment colour that made them too dark.
development_findings.quote: I had to change a bunch of combiners because they all had environment colour and it made everything look very dark.

development_findings.summary: Created a generic net-physics function so moving nets/meshes are now trivial to add.
development_findings.quote: I wrote a generic function for this now, so this is super easy to add to anything.

development_findings.summary: Added dialogue-style cut-scene boxes for NPC conversations and showcased first implementation.
development_findings.quote: We have new dialogue cutscenes. You see that?

development_findings.summary: Improved room-system algorithm so off-screen actors stop processing more efficiently, removing some lag.
development_findings.quote: I actually improved that algorithm recently. It’s a lot better now – a bit of lag is gone from that.

development_findings.summary: Brain-stormed secret-star design: player discovers hidden door, Shy Guys flee, Mario pursues via multiple mine-carts while Snuffits shoot large iron balls; ends in cave with star.  Final decision: six mine-carts (2 rows × 3) the player jumps between.
development_findings.quote: We’re going to try the three-by-three – well, two-by-three – minecart idea, so six minecarts in total.

development_findings.summary: Technical plan for chase: use splines and invisible collision walls that are only active while Mario rides mine-cart to guide turning segments.
development_findings.quote: There’s a dynamic object that is only solid while you are in the minecart; it’s like a wall the minecart drives along around the curves.

development_findings.summary: Net 8 MB expansion build assumed; segmenting gives 3-5 % speed-up.
development_findings.quote: The extra 4 MB lets you do memory segmenting a little bit, which is like a 3-5 % speed-up.

development_findings.summary: Background discussion on texture filtering and GlideN64 bug; chooses textures that render correctly on console.
Considering camera consistency: may switch L-button to full first-person everywhere for keyboard players.
development_findings.quote: I’m still considering just going full first-person… probably should do that just for consistency.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s OBS crashed at stream start; girlfriend’s mother was recently hospitalised, described as "fucking depressing".
context_findings.quote: Since last stream, my girlfriend's mom had to go to the hospital – that’s fucking depressing.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: game will be free and open-source; dislikes selling ROMs, prefers merch like an OST cartridge.
context_findings.quote: I think video games shouldn’t be monetised off of game sales… I might sell a version that’s just the OST cartridge.

context_findings.summary: Reflects on Nintendo DMCA history – over 70 of his videos removed – yet continues development.
context_findings.quote: I had 70 of my videos taken down… my channel would be a lot more blown up if it wasn’t for Nintendo trying to sabotage me.

context_findings.summary: Expresses minimalist lifestyle: buys cheapest functioning gear, disinterest in luxury items.
context_findings.quote: I don’t value having expensive stuff at all.

context_findings.summary: Frequent broader philosophising (eternal life, porn, consumerism) shows tendency to embed personal worldview during work.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback on vertex shading, textures, and suggested humorous "bounty" dialogue easter-egg to hide atop the giant hat.
biobak.quote: One NPC should mention the bounty conspiracy… We do things the milky way here.

zeina.summary: Was supposed to supply milk-bottle assets for saloon secret but "forgot", causing a minor asset gap.
zeina.quote: We still need a bunch of milk bottles and stuff and Zeina said she wanted to give those to us, but I guess she forgot.

key_stories.title: Designing the Mine-cart Chase Star
key_stories.summary: Saloon’s secret room needed a memorable star.  After brainstorming races, MIPS-style chases and tactical shooting, Kaze settled on a multi-cart pursuit: Shy Guys flee through a cave on mine-carts while shooting at Mario.
key_stories.challenge: Create an exciting, technically feasible secret mission distinct from existing Goomba and MIPS chases.
key_stories.process: Discussed mechanics with chat; evaluated single cart vs multiple carts, camera issues, collision tricks, spline paths; balanced difficulty; chose six carts with Snuffits firing large projectiles.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed on 2 × 3 mine-cart layout, player jumps between carts; technical plan drafted for next session.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re going to try the three-by-three – well, two-by-three – minecart idea, so six minecarts in total.

key_stories.title: Fixing Shy Guy Shading
key_stories.summary: Shy Guy models appeared overly dark and blinked due to environment-colour settings in combiners.
key_stories.challenge: Incorrect combiner settings made enemies visually inconsistent.
key_stories.process: Identified environment colour causing darkening; edited combiner commands across affected assets.
key_stories.outcome: Shy Guys now render correctly; lesson for future imports.
key_stories.key_quote: I had to change a bunch of combiners because they all had environment colour and it made everything look very dark.

key_stories.title: Open-source Release Philosophy
key_stories.summary: Kaze debated monetisation with chat and reaffirmed commitment to a free, open-source release, possibly funding via physical OST cartridges.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing desire for compensation with legal and ethical stance against selling ROMs.
key_stories.process: Explained objections to conventional sales; explored souvenir-style merch; gauged audience reaction.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative plan: free ROM + optional OST cartridge with box/manual.
key_stories.key_quote: You can’t buy the game, but you can buy a souvenir about the game.

open_questions.context: High-level plan agreed, but spline paths, camera behaviour, enemy AI and failure states remain undecided.
questions: Will Mario control be limited or full during the chase?
How will camera transitions handle tight corners?
Will failure fade-out or instant death best communicate missing the carts?

open_questions.context: Zeina had promised bottles for the saloon but they are still absent.
questions: Are there contingency plans if assets stay late?

open_questions.topic: Final decision on first-person camera toggle
open_questions.context: Kaze leans toward always entering full first-person when L is held, but not final.
questions: What user testing will decide this?
How will consistency with Yoshi hook be ensured?

open_questions.topic: Level background and new flame model
open_questions.context: Background and flame particle effect are still missing.
questions: What style reference or influences will guide the background art?
What technical method will be used for flame particles?
